sen.j: 正倉院（しょうそういん）は、奈良市の東大寺大仏殿の北西に位置する、高床の大規模な校倉造（あぜくらづくり）倉庫である。
sen.e: Shosoin is a large warehouse with a raised floor in Azekura-zukuri style (a style of architecture in which the sides of the building are made by placing logs across each other) which is located in the northwest of the Daibutsu-den Hall (the Great Buddha Hall) of Todai-ji Temple in Nara City.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shosoin is a large warehouse with a raised floor in the Azekura-zukuri style (a style of architecture in which the sides of the building are made by placing logs across each other), which is located in the northwest of the Daibutsu-den Hall (the Great Buddha Hall) of Todai-ji Temple in Nara City.

Shosoin is a large warehouse with a raised floor in the Azekura-zukuri style (a style of architecture in which the sides of the building are made by placing logs across each other), which is located in the northwest of the Daibutsu-den Hall (the Great Buddha Hall) of Todai-ji Temple in Nara City.

sen.j: 聖武天皇・光明皇后ゆかりの品をはじめとする、天平文化を中心とした多数の美術工芸品を収蔵していた。
sen.e: There were a variety of arts and crafts stored there, mainly from Tenpyo culture, including articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: A variety of arts and crafts were stored there, mainly from the Tenpyo culture, including articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.
A variety of arts and crafts were stored there, mainly from the Tenpyo culture, including articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.

sen.j: 「古都奈良の文化財」の一部として国際連合教育科学文化機関の世界遺産（文化遺産）に登録されている。
sen.e: Shosoin is registered as a World Heritage site (Cultural Heritage) as part of Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).
Shosoin is registered as a World Heritage site (Cultural Heritage) as part of Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).
Shosoin is registered as a World Heritage site (Cultural Heritage) as part of Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara by the United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization (UNESCO).

sen.j: 元は東大寺の倉庫であったが、明治以降、国の管理下におかれた。
sen.e: It was a storeroom in Todai-ji Temple but was taken under national control after the Meiji era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was a storeroom in Todai-ji Temple, but after the Meiji period it was taken under national control.
It was a storeroom in Todai-ji Temple, but after the Meiji period it was taken under national control.

sen.j: 内務省 (日本)、農商務省と所管省庁は変遷し、1884年宮内省所管となった。
sen.e: In 1884 the Imperial Household Ministry took over the administration of Shosoin after it had previously been administered by the Ministry of Interior (Japan) and then by the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1884, the Imperial Household Ministry assumed the administration of Shosoin after it had previously been administered by the Ministry of Interior (Japan) and then the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.

In 1884, the Imperial Household Ministry assumed the administration of Shosoin after it had previously been administered by the Ministry of Interior (Japan) and then the Ministry of Agriculture and Commerce.

sen.j: 第二次大戦後は宮内府を経て、現在は正倉院事務所が管理している。
sen.e: Shosoin was also administered by Kunaifu (Imperial Household Office) after the World War II and is currently being administered by Shosoin Jimusho (Shosoin Office).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shosoin was also administered by Kunaifu (the Imperial Household Office) after World War II, and currently it's administered by Shosoin Jimusho (the Shosoin Office).
Shosoin was also administered by Kunaifu (the Imperial Household Office) after World War II, and currently it is administered by Shosoin Jimusho (the Shosoin Office).

sen.j: 正倉院事務所は宮内庁の正倉院宝庫及び正倉院宝物を管理する施設等機関である。
sen.e: Shosoin Office is an organization under the Imperial Household Agency ("Kunaicho" in Japanese) and manages the Shosoin treasures and Shosoin treasure house.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処施設等機関 = Facilities, Affiliated institutions定訳不明ですので、ここでは単にorganizationとしました。
sen.e: The Shosoin Office is an organization under the Imperial Household Agency ("Kunaicho" in Japanese) that manages the Shosoin treasures and Shosoin treasure house.
The Shosoin Office is an organization under the Imperial Household Agency ("Kunaicho" in Japanese) that manages the Shosoin treasures and Shosoin treasure house.

sen.j: 正倉院の宝物には日本製品、中国（唐）や西域、遠くは ペルシャなどからの輸入品を含めた絵画・書跡・金工・漆工・木工・刀剣・陶器・ガラス器・楽器・仮面など、古代の美術工芸の粋を集めた作品が多く残る。
sen.e: Treasures in Shosoin are from Japan, China (Tang), and the Western Orient as far as Persia,and include numerous paintings, calligraphy, metalwork, lacquerware, woodwork, swords, ceramics, glassware, musical instruments, and masks, and constitute the cream of ancient arts and crafts.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The treasures in Shosoin are from Japan, China (Tang) and the western Orient as far as Persia, and include numerous paintings, calligraphy, metalwork, lacquerware, woodwork, swords, ceramics, glassware, musical instruments, and masks, thus constituting the creme of ancient arts and crafts.

The treasures in Shosoin are from Japan, China (Tang) and the western Orient as far as Persia, and include numerous paintings, calligraphy, metalwork, lacquerware, woodwork, swords, ceramics, glassware, musical instruments, and masks, thus constituting the creme of ancient arts and crafts.

sen.j: ほかに、奈良時代の日本を知るうえで貴重な史料である正倉院文書（もんじょ）、東大寺大仏開眼法要に関わる歴史的な品や古代の薬品なども所蔵され、文化財の一大宝庫である。
sen.e: In addition to these treasures are the Shosoin archives ("Shosoin Monjo" in Japanese), which are important historical records to help understand Japan during the Nara period, historical articles related to the Todai-ji Temple Great Buddha Eye-opening ceremony, and ancient medicines, all of which make Shosoin one of the greatest reservoirs of cultural assets to be found.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In addition to these treasures are the Shosoin archives ("Shosoin Monjo" in Japanese), which are important historical records that aid in the understanding of Japan during the Nara period; historical articles related to the Todai-ji Temple Great Buddha Eye-Opening ceremony; and ancient medicines, all of which make Shosoin one of the greatest reservoirs of cultural assets to be found.

In addition to these treasures are the Shosoin archives ("Shosoin Monjo" in Japanese), which are important historical records that aid in the understanding of Japan during the Nara period; historical articles related to the Todai-ji Temple Great Buddha Eye-Opening ceremony; and ancient medicines, all of which make Shosoin one of the greatest reservoirs of cultural assets to be found.

sen.j: シルクロードの東の終点ともいわれる。
sen.e: Shosoin is described as being at the eastern end of the Silk Road.
Shosoin is described as being at the eastern end of the Silk Road.
Shosoin is described as being at the eastern end of the Silk Road.

sen.j: 奈良時代の役所や大寺院には多数の倉が並んでいたことが記録から知られる。
sen.e: Records revealed that many warehouses were built in government offices and large temples in the Nara period.
Records have revealed that many warehouses were built in government offices and large temples during the Nara period.
Records have revealed that many warehouses were built in government offices and large temples during the Nara period.

sen.j: 「正倉」とは、元来、「正税を収める倉」の意であった。
sen.e: "Shoso" originally meant a warehouse to keep "shozei" tax.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: "Shoso" originally referred to warehouses in which to keep the "shozei" tax.
"Shoso" originally referred to warehouses in which to keep the "shozei" tax.

sen.j: 奈良時代に各地から上納された米穀や物品などを保管するため、大蔵省をはじめとする役所に設けられたものであった。
sen.e: They were built in administrative offices (including the Treasury Ministry - "Okurasho" in Japanese) to keep rice and other articles from different regions which were paid as a tax during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: They were built in administrative offices (including the Treasury Ministry, or "Okurasho" in Japanese) to keep rice and other articles from different regions, which were paid as a tax during the Nara period.

They were built in administrative offices (including the Treasury Ministry, or "Okurasho" in Japanese) to keep rice and other articles from different regions, which were paid as a tax during the Nara period.

sen.j: また、大寺にはそれぞれの寺領から納められた品や、寺の什器宝物などを収蔵する倉があった。
sen.e: Additionally, large temples had a warehouse to keep the articles offered by their estates, and temple household goods and treasures.
Additionally, large temples had warehouses in which to keep the articles offered by their estates, as well as temple household goods and treasures.
Additionally, large temples had warehouses in which to keep the articles offered by their estates, as well as temple household goods and treasures.

sen.j: これを正倉といい、正倉のある一画を塀で囲ったものを「正倉院」といった。
sen.e: This warehouse was called "shoso" and a fenced-off area where there was a shoso was called "shosoin".
This warehouse was called "shoso," and a fenced-off area containing a shoso was called "shosoin."
This warehouse was called "shoso," and a fenced-off area containing a shoso was called "shosoin."

sen.j: 南都七大寺にはそれぞれ正倉院があったが、のちに廃絶して東大寺のもののみが残っている。
sen.e: The Seven Great Temples of Nara used to have their own "shosoin" but they were all lost except the one in Todai-ji Temple.
Each of the Seven Great Temples of Nara once had its own "shosoin," but they were all lost except for the one in Todai-ji Temple.
Each of the Seven Great Temples of Nara once had its own "shosoin," but they were all lost except for the one in Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: このため、「正倉院」は東大寺大仏殿北西に所在する宝庫を指す固有名詞と化している。
sen.e: Therefore now the name of 'Shosoin' is a proper noun to mean specifically the treasure house located in the northwest of Daibutsu-den Hall, Todai-ji Temple.
Therefore, the name of 'Shosoin' is now a proper noun that specifically means the treasure house located in the northwest of Daibutsu-den Hall, Todai-ji Temple.
Therefore, the name of 'Shosoin' is now a proper noun that specifically means the treasure house located in the northwest of Daibutsu-den Hall, Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 756年（天平勝宝8歳）、光明皇后は、夫聖武天皇の七七忌に、天皇遺愛の品約650点と、約60種の薬物を東大寺の廬舎那仏（大仏）に奉献した。
sen.e: In the year 756 Empress Komyo dedicated approximately 650 items associated with her late husband, Emperor Shomu, and approximately 60 kinds of medicines to Rushanabutsu (Great Buddha) on the 49th day after the Emperor's death.

In the year 756, Empress Komyo dedicated approximately 650 items associated with her late husband, Emperor Shomu, along with approximately 60 kinds of medicines, to Rushanabutsu (Great Buddha) on the forty-ninth day after the Emperor's death.

In the year 756, Empress Komyo dedicated approximately 650 items associated with her late husband, Emperor Shomu, along with approximately 60 kinds of medicines, to Rushanabutsu (Great Buddha) on the forty-ninth day after the Emperor's death.

sen.j: その後も光明皇后は3度にわたって、自身や聖武天皇ゆかりの品を大仏に奉献している。
sen.e: Empress Komyo dedicated articles associated with Emperor Shomu and herself to the Great Buddha on three different occasions.
Empress Komyo dedicated articles associated with Emperor Shomu and herself to the Great Buddha on three different occasions.
Empress Komyo dedicated articles associated with Emperor Shomu and herself to the Great Buddha on three different occasions.

sen.j: これらの献納品については、現存する5種類の「献物帳」と呼ばれる文書に目録が記されている。
sen.e: These articles are listed in the five kinds of Kenmotsu Cho (list of treasures dedicated to a temple) still in existence.
These articles are listed among the five kinds of Kenmotsu Cho (list of treasures dedicated to a temple) still in existence.
These articles are listed among the five kinds of Kenmotsu Cho (list of treasures dedicated to a temple) still in existence.

sen.j: これらの宝物は正倉院に収められた。
sen.e: These treasures were stored in Shosoin.
These treasures were stored in Shosoin.
These treasures were stored in Shosoin.

tit.cmt: 英訳は下の文章内でする方が良いと判断しました。

sen.j: 正倉院宝庫は、北倉（ほくそう）、中倉（ちゅうそう）、南倉（なんそう）の3つに区分されている。
sen.e: The treasure house in Shosoin is divided into three sections; Hokuso (North section), Chuso (Middle section), and Nanso (South section).
The treasure house in Shosoin is divided into three sections; Hokuso (north section), Chuso (middle section) and Nanso (south section).
The treasure house in Shosoin is divided into three sections; Hokuso (north section), Chuso (middle section) and Nanso (south section).

sen.j: 北倉にはおもに聖武天皇・光明皇后ゆかりの品が収められ、中倉には東大寺の儀式関係品、文書記録、造東大寺司関係品などが収められていた。
sen.e: The articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo were kept in Hokuso, and the articles used in rituals in Todai-ji Temple, written documents, and articles related to the Office of Todai-ji Temple Construction ("Zotodaiji shi" in Japanese) were kept in Chuso.

The articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo were kept in Hokuso; the articles used in the rituals of Todai-ji Temple, written documents and articles related to the Office of Todai-ji Temple Construction ("Zotodaiji shi" in Japanese) were kept in Chuso.

The articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo were kept in Hokuso; the articles used in the rituals of Todai-ji Temple, written documents and articles related to the Office of Todai-ji Temple Construction ("Zotodaiji shi" in Japanese) were kept in Chuso.

sen.j: また、950年（天暦4年）、東大寺内にあった羂索院（けんさくいん）の双倉（ならびくら）が破損した際、そこに収められていた物品が正倉院南倉に移されている。
sen.e: When the twin warehouses called Narabikura, Kensakuin (the official treasure houses of the Todai-ji Temple) were damaged in 950, the items originally kept there were moved to Nanso, Shosoin

In the year 950, when the twin warehouses called Narabikura and Kensakuin (the official treasure houses of the Todai-ji Temple) were damaged, the items originally kept there were moved to Nanso, Shosoin.

In the year 950, when the twin warehouses called Narabikura of Kensakuin (the official treasure houses of the Todai-ji Temple) were damaged, the items originally kept there were moved to Nanso, Shosoin.
sen.cmt: Narabikura and Kensakuin→Narabikura of Kensakuinに修正しました。

sen.j: 南倉宝物には、仏具類のほか、東大寺盧舎那仏像開眼会（かいげんえ）に使用された物品なども納められていた。
sen.e: The treasures kept in Nanso include Buddhist altar fittings, and the articles used in Kaigen-e (the ceremony of "kaigen "whereby a newly built Buddhist image is brought to life by having its eyes opened) for the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple.

The treasures kept in Nanso include Buddhist altar fittings and the articles used in Kaigen-e (the ceremony of "kaigen "whereby a newly built Buddhist image is brought to life by having its eyes opened) for the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple.

The treasures kept in Nanso include Buddhist altar fittings and the articles used in Kaigen-e (the ceremony of "kaigen "whereby a newly built Buddhist image is brought to life by having its eyes opened) for the statue of Birushana Buddha in Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: ただし、1185年の後白河法皇による大仏再興時の開眼会に宝物の仏具類が用いられた。
sen.e: Later, in 1185, these Buddhist altar fittings were used by Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa in the Kaigen-e of the restored Buddha statue.
Later, in 1185, these Buddhist altar fittings were used by Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa in the Kaigen-e of the restored Buddha statue.
Later, in 1185, these Buddhist altar fittings were used by Cloistered Emperor Goshirakawa in the Kaigen-e of the restored Buddha statue.

sen.j: そのほか、長い年月の間には、修理などのために宝物が倉から取り出されることがたびたびあった。
sen.e: In addition, over the course of time the treasures were often taken out of the warehouses for repair or for some other reason.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, over time the treasures were often taken out of the warehouses for repair or some other reason.
Additionally, over time the treasures were often taken out of the warehouses for repair or some other reason.

sen.j: 返納の際に違う倉に戻されたものなどがあって、宝物の所在場所はかなり移動している。
sen.e: Some of them were then returned to the wrong warehouse, moving them from their original places.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Some of them were then returned to the wrong warehouse, consequently losing their original places.
Some of them were then returned to the wrong warehouse, consequently losing their original places.

sen.j: 上述のような倉ごとの品物の区分は明治時代以降、近代的な文化財調査が行われるようになってから再整理されたものである。
sen.e: The reclassification of the articles according to warehouse (as mentioned above) is based on modern research of cultural property after the Meiji era.
The reclassification of the articles by warehouse (as mentioned above) is based on modern research of cultural properties after the Meiji period.
The reclassification of the articles by warehouse (as mentioned above) is based on modern research of cultural properties after the Meiji period.

sen.j: 「献物帳」記載の品がそのまま現存しているわけではなく、武器類、薬物、書巻、楽器などは必要に応じて出蔵され、そのまま戻らなかった品も多い。
sen.e: Not all of the items listed on Kenmotsu Cho still exist, and many of the them such as weapons, medicines, books and musical instruments were taken out of the warehouses when they were needed and never returned.

Not all the items listed on Kenmotsu Cho still exist, and many of them, such as weapons, medicines, books and musical instruments, were taken out of the warehouses when they were needed but never returned.

Not all the items listed on Kenmotsu Cho still exist, and many of them, such as weapons, medicines, books and musical instruments, were taken out of the warehouses when they were needed but never returned.

sen.j: 刀剣類などは藤原仲麻呂の乱の際に大量に持ち出され、「献物帳」記載の品とは別の刀剣が代わりに返納されている。
sen.e: Many swords were taken out in FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War, with different swords from the ones listed in Kenmotsu Cho being returned.
Many swords were taken out in FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War, and instead swords different from those listed in Kenmotsu Cho were returned.
Many swords were taken out in FUJIWARA no Nakamaro's War, and instead swords different from those listed in Kenmotsu Cho were returned.

sen.j: 正倉院の三倉のなかでも特に北倉は聖武天皇・光明皇后ゆかりの品を収めることから、早くから厳重な管理がなされていた。
sen.e: Out of the three warehouses of Shosoin, Hokuso particularly was put under strict administration from early on as it kept the articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.
Out of the three warehouses of Shosoin, Hokuso in particular was placed under strict administration from early on, since it held the articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.
Out of the three warehouses of Shosoin, Hokuso in particular was placed under strict administration from early on, since it held the articles associated with Emperor Shomu and Empress Komyo.

sen.j: 宝庫の扉の開封には勅使（天皇からの使い）が立ち会うことが必要とされていた。
sen.e: Opening the door of the treasure house required an inspection by an imperial envoy ("chokushi" in Japanese).
Opening the door of the treasure house required an inspection by an imperial envoy ("chokushi" in Japanese).
Opening the door of the treasure house required an inspection by an imperial envoy ("chokushi" in Japanese).

sen.j: なお「勅封」という言葉は本来「天皇の署名入りの紙を鍵に巻きつけて施錠すること」を指す。
sen.e: The word "Chokufu" (Imperial Seal) originally meant to lock by twisting paper with the emperor's signature around a key.
The word "Chokufu" (Imperial seal) originally meant to lock by twisting paper with the emperor's signature around a key.
The word "Chokufu" (Imperial seal) originally meant to lock by twisting paper with the emperor's signature around a key.

sen.j: 正倉院宝庫がこの厳密な意味での「勅封」になったのは室町時代以降である。
sen.e: Shosoin treasure house became Chokufu in this strict meaning after the Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Shosoin treasure house became Chokufu in this strict sense after the Muromachi period.
The Shosoin treasure house became Chokufu in this strict sense after the Muromachi period.

sen.j: しかし、平安時代の各種文書記録にも正倉院を「勅封蔵」と表現しており、事実上の勅封であったと見なして差し支えないといわれる。
sen.e: However some written records in the Heian period also express Shosoin as a chokufu warehouse, so we can regard it as practically Chokufu even then.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: However some written records in the Heian period also express Shosoin as a chokufu warehouse, so we can regard it as practically Chokufu even then.
However some written records in the Heian period also express Shosoin as a Chokufu warehouse, so we can regard it as practically Chokufu even then.
sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、chokufu→Chokufuとしました。

sen.j: 平安時代中期には北・中・南の三倉とも勅封蔵と見なされていたが、東大寺の什器類を納めていた南倉のみは、後に勅封から綱封（東大寺別当らの寺僧組織が管理する）に改められた。
sen.e: In the mid-Heian period all three warehouses (North, Middle, and South) were regarded as chokufu warehouses, but later on the south section became "Kofu", administered by temple and monk organizations run for example by the head secretary of Todai-ji Temple instead of by Chokufu.

In the mid-Heian period, all three warehouses (north, middle and south) were regarded as chokufu warehouses, but later the south section became "Kofu," administered by temple and monk organizations run, for example, by the head secretary of Todai-ji Temple instead of by Chokufu.

In the mid-Heian period, all three warehouses (north, middle and south) were regarded as Chokufu warehouses, but later the south section became "Kofu," administered by temple and monk organizations run, for example, by the head secretary of Todai-ji Temple instead of by Chokufu.
sen.cmt: 表記統一のため、chokufu→Chokufuとしました。

sen.j: 1875年（明治8年）、正倉院全体が明治政府の管理下におかれてからは南倉も再び勅封となっている。
sen.e: After the whole Shosoin was put under administration by the Meiji Government, the South section reverted back to Chokufu.
After the whole of Shosoin was placed under administration by the Meiji Government, the south section reverted back to Chokufu.
After the whole of Shosoin was placed under administration by the Meiji Government in 1875, the south section reverted back to Chokufu.
sen.cmt: 「1875年（明治8年）」→訳漏れのため訳出しました。

sen.j: 正倉院宝物は通常時、非公開である。
sen.e: Shosoin treasures are normally not open to the public.
Shosoin treasures are normally not open to the public.
Shosoin treasures are normally not open to the public.

sen.j: 1875年～1880年、毎年開催された奈良博覧会の一環として、東大寺大仏殿回廊で、一部が一般に公開された。
sen.e: Some of the treasures were opened to the public in the cloister of the Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple as part of Nara Exhibition held annually from 1875 to 1880.
Some of the treasures were opened to the public in the cloister of the Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple as part of the Nara Exhibition, which was held annually from 1875 to 1880.
Some of the treasures were opened to the public in the cloister of the Great Buddha Hall of Todai-ji Temple as part of the Nara Exhibition, which was held annually from 1875 to 1880.

sen.j: 1889年～1940年では、正倉院内の陳列棚を設けて、曝涼（宝物の「虫干し」のことで定期的に行われる）の際に限られた人々に拝観を許していた。
sen.e: From 1889 to 1940 a limited number of people were given the opportunity to see some of the treasures in Shosoin on display shelves during "bakuryo" (the regularly-held airing of treasures),
From 1889 to 1940, limited numbers of people were given the opportunity to see some of the treasures in Shosoin on display shelves during "bakuryo" (the regularly held airing of treasures).
From 1889 to 1940, limited numbers of people were given the opportunity to see some of the treasures in Shosoin on display shelves during "bakuryo" (the regularly held airing of treasures).

sen.j: また、外国の高官のため、特に開封することもあった（例、1922年英国皇太子拝観）。
sen.e: In addition Shosoin sometimes opened specially for foreign high-level public officials (for example Britain's Crown Prince in 1992).
Moreover, Shosoin sometimes opened especially for foreign high-level public officials (for example, Great Britain's Crown Prince, who visited in 1992).
Moreover, Shosoin sometimes opened especially for foreign high-level public officials (for example, Great Britain's Crown Prince, who visited in 1992).

sen.j: 戦前の大規模な一般公開は、1940年11月（約140点）。
sen.e: Before the war, in November 1940, there was a large-scale opening to the public of approximately 140 items.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before the war, in November 1940, there was a large-scale public opening in which approximately 140 items were shown.
Before the war, in November 1940, there was a large-scale public opening in which approximately 140 items were shown.

sen.j: 皇紀2600年記念として東京の帝室博物館で開催された正倉院御物特別展であった。
sen.e: This opening was for the Special Exhibition of Imperial Articles in Shosoin held in the Imperial Museum, Tokyo, to commemorate the 2600th anniversary of the Imperial era.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This opening was for the Special Exhibition of Imperial Articles in Shosoin, held at the Imperial Museum, Tokyo, to commemorate the 2,600 years of the Imperial era.
This opening was for the Special Exhibition of Imperial Articles in Shosoin, held at the Imperial Museum, Tokyo, to commemorate the 2,600 years of the Imperial era.

sen.j: 戦後、1946年からは毎年秋、2ヶ月の曝涼にあわせて、近隣の奈良公園内にある奈良国立博物館で開催されるようになった。
sen.e: After the war, during every autumn since 1946, the exhibition has been held in Nara National Museum inside Nara Park near to Shosoin in accordance with the two month airing.
Subsequent to the war, each autumn since 1946, the exhibition has been held at Nara National Museum inside Nara Park near to Shosoin, in accordance with the two-month airing.
Subsequent to the war, each autumn since 1946, the exhibition has been held at Nara National Museum inside Nara Park near to Shosoin, in accordance with the two-month airing.

sen.j: 管理する宮内庁は整理済みの物だけで9000点に上る。
sen.e: There are 9000 items of treasure already organized and administered by the Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: 「管理する宮内省は整理済みのもの」は意味不明ですがWikiのページは意味が通るように書き直されていましたのでそちらに従いました。一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: There are 9,000 items of treasure organized and administered by the Imperial Household Agency.
There are 9,000 items of treasure organized and administered by the Imperial Household Agency.

sen.j: このうち公開される宝物の品目は毎年変更され約数十点のみである。
sen.e: Only some tens of items are displayed at the exhibition and these are changed every year.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Only some tens of items are displayed at each exhibition, and the selection is changed annually.
Only some tens of items are displayed at each exhibition, and the selection is changed annually.

sen.j: よって代表的な宝物を見るには複数年の見学が必要になる。
sen.e: Consequently to see its most famous treasures takes visits over several years.
Consequently, several years' visits would be needed in order to see its most famous treasures.
Consequently, several years' visits would be needed in order to see its most famous treasures.

sen.j: 学芸員が手作業で点検と陳列を慎重に行うがそれに前後約40日の時間を必要とする。
sen.e: It takes approximately 40 days before and after the exhibition for curators to carefully check the items to display by hand.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It takes approximately 40 days before and after the exhibition for curators to carefully hand-check the items to be displayed.
It takes approximately 40 days before and after the exhibition for curators to carefully hand-check the items to be displayed.

sen.j: そのため、開催期間は約2週間程度と短い。
sen.e: This makes the duration of the exhibition rather short, at only about two weeks.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This makes the duration of the exhibition rather short, at only about two weeks.
This makes the duration of the exhibition rather short, at only about two weeks.

sen.j: 2008年に第60回を迎えた。
sen.e: The 60th exhibition was held in 2008.
The sixtieth exhibition was held in 2008.
The sixtieth exhibition was held in 2008.

sen.j: 毎年多くの見学者を集めている。
sen.e: The exhibition receives many visitors each year.
The exhibition receives many visitors each year.
The exhibition receives many visitors each year.

tit.j: 建造物としての正倉院

sen.j: 校倉造、屋根は寄棟造、瓦葺。
sen.e: Shosoin is built in Azekura-zukuri style while its roof is tiled and in the style of yosemune-zukuri (a square or rectangular building covered with a hipped roof).
Shosoin is built in the Azekura-zukuri style, while its roof is tiled and in the style of yosemune-zukuri (a square or rectangular building covered with a hipped roof).
Shosoin is built in the Azekura-zukuri style, while its roof is tiled and in the style of yosemune-zukuri (a square or rectangular building covered with a hipped roof).

sen.j: 規模は正面約33.1メートル、奥行約9.3メートル、床下の柱の高さ約2.5メートルである。
sen.e: The front of Shosoin is approximately 33.1m wide, the inside depth is approximately 9.3m and the height of the columns under the floor is approximately 2.5m.
The front of Shosoin is approximately 33.1m wide, the inside depth is approximately 9.3m, and the height of the columns under the floor is approximately 2.5m.
The front of Shosoin is approximately 33.1m wide, the inside depth is approximately 9.3m, and the height of the columns under the floor is approximately 2.5m.

sen.j: 建立時期は不明だが、光明皇后が夫聖武天皇の遺愛の品を大仏に奉献した756年（天平勝宝8）前後とみるのが通説である。
sen.e: It is not known exactly when Shosoin was built, however it is generally accepted that it was around 756 when Empress Komyo dedicated the late Emperor Shomu's favorite articles to the Daibutsu.
It is not known exactly when Shosoin was built, but it's generally accepted as around 756, when Empress Komyo dedicated the late Emperor Shomu's favorite articles to the Daibutsu.
It is not known exactly when Shosoin was built, but it is generally accepted as around 756, when Empress Komyo dedicated the late Emperor Shomu's favorite articles to the Daibutsu.

sen.j: 759年（天平宝字3年）以降、宝物出納の記録が残っていることから、この年までに建立されていたことがわかる。
sen.e: We know that it was already built by 759 because there were records of the treasures being taken in and out that year and the year after.
We know that it was already built by 759 because there were records of the treasures being taken in and out that year and the year after.
We know that it was already built by 759 because there were records of the treasures being taken in and out that year and the year after.

sen.j: 当初の正倉院の建物構成についてはわかっておらず、記録によれば、平安末期には現存する宝庫1棟を残すのみであったらしい。
sen.e: The original building structure of Shosoin is unknown and according to a written record there remained only one treasure house by the late Heian period.
The original building structure of Shosoin is not known, and according to a written record there remained only one treasure house by the late Heian period.
The original building structure of Shosoin is not known, and according to a written record there remained only one treasure house by the late Heian period.

sen.j: 床下には10列×4列の柱を建て、その上に台輪（だいわ）と呼ぶ水平材を置く。
sen.e: Horizontal materials called "daiwa (architrave)" are placed on 10 x 4 columns built under a floor.
Horizontal materials called "daiwa (architraves)" are placed on 10 x 4 columns built under a floor.
Horizontal materials called "daiwa" (architraves) are placed on 10 x 4 columns built under a floor.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションの位置を移動しました。

sen.j: この上に北倉と南倉は校木（あぜぎ）という断面三角形の材を20段重ねて壁体をつくり、校倉造とする。
sen.e: To build a wall (called Azekura-zukuri) on top of the daiwa, Hokuso and Nanso have a layer of 20 wooden beams the section of which is triangular ("azeki" in Japanese).
To build a wall (called Azekura-zukuri) on top of the daiwa, Hokuso and Nanso have a layer of 20 wooden beams the section of which is triangular ("azeki" in Japanese).
To build a wall (called Azekura-zukuri) on top of the daiwa, Hokuso and Nanso have a layer of 20 wooden beams the section of which is triangular ("azeki" in Japanese).

sen.j: ただし、中倉のみは校倉造ではなく、柱と柱の間に厚板を落とし込んだ「板倉」で、構造が異なる。
sen.e: Only Chuso is not in Azekura-zukuri style, but in "Itakura" style instead, made by dropping thick wood panels between columns.
Only Chuso is not in the Azekura-zukuri style but is instead in the "Itakura" style, having been made by dropping thick wood panels between columns.
Only Chuso is not in the Azekura-zukuri style but is instead in the "Itakura" style, having been made by dropping thick wood panels between columns.

sen.j: なぜ、中倉のみ構造が異なるのか、当初からこのような形式であったのかどうかについては、諸説ある。
sen.e: There are various theories as to why only Chuso has a different structure, and whether it is in fact the original style.
There are various theories as to why only Chuso has a different structure and whether it is actually the original style.
There are various theories as to why only Chuso has a different structure and whether it is actually the original style.

sen.j: 奈良時代の文書には、正倉院宝庫のことを「双倉」（そうそう、ならびくら）と称しているものがある。
sen.e: The treasure house of Shosoin was referred to as twin warehouses (called "soso" or "narabikura" in Japanese) in a document in the Nara period.
The treasure house of Shosoin was referred to as twin warehouses (called "soso" or "narabikura" in Japanese) in a document written during the Nara period.
The treasure house of Shosoin was referred to as twin warehouses (called "soso" or "narabikura" in Japanese) in a document written during the Nara period.

sen.j: このことから、元来の正倉院は北側と南側の校倉部分のみが倉庫で、中倉にあたる中間部は、壁もなく床板も張らない吹き放しであったと考えられる。
sen.e: For this reason the original form of Shosoin was considered to be the azekura-style of Hokuso and Nanso, which were the only warehouses, while the center Chuso part was open to the wind, with no wall or floor panels used.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For that reason, the original form of Shosoin was considered to be the Azekura-style of Hokuso and Nanso, which were the only warehouses, while the center Chuso part was open to the breeze without the use of wall or floor panels.

For that reason, the original form of Shosoin was considered to be the Azekura-style of Hokuso and Nanso, which were the only warehouses, while the center Chuso part was open to the breeze without the use of wall or floor panels.

sen.j: そのため「双倉」と呼ばれたとするのが通説である。
sen.e: It is generally accepted this why Shosoin was called twin warehouses..
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: This is generally accepted as the reason Shosoin was referred to as twin warehouses.
This is generally accepted as the reason Shosoin was referred to as twin warehouses.

sen.j: 校倉の利点として、湿度の高い時には木材が膨張して外部の湿気が入るのを防ぎ、倉庫内の環境を一定に保ち、物の保存に役立ったという説があった。
sen.e: It was assumed that the benefit of the azekura-style was that it helped in the preservation of articles by maintaining a stable inside environment because when the humidity is high the wood swells and prevents moisture entering the warehouse,
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It has been assumed that the benefit of the azekura-style was that it helped in the preservation of articles by maintaining a stable interior environment because, when the humidity is high, the wood swells and prevents moisture from entering the warehouse.

It has been assumed that the benefit of the azekura-style was that it helped in the preservation of articles by maintaining a stable interior environment because, when the humidity is high, the wood swells and prevents moisture from entering the warehouse.

sen.j: 逆に外気が乾燥している時は木材が収縮して材と材の間に隙間ができて風を通す。
sen.e: On the other hand when the outside air is dry, the wood constricts and spaces appear which let the wind in.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On the other hand, when the outside air is dry the wood constricts and spaces appear, thereby allowing the breeze to pass through.
On the other hand, when the outside air is dry the wood constricts and spaces appear, thereby allowing the breeze to pass through.

sen.j: しかし、実際には、重い屋根荷重がかかる校木が伸縮する余地はなく、この説は否定されている。
sen.e: As a matter of a fact however because the logs carry the heavy load of the roof there is no room for azeki (corner logs) to swell or contract, so this theory can't be correct.
However, because the logs carry the heavy load of the roof there is no room for azeki (corner logs) to swell or contract, so this theory can't be correct.
However, because the logs carry the heavy load of the roof there is no room for azeki (corner logs) to swell or contract, so this theory cannot be correct.

sen.j: また、この工法はログハウスの丸太組み工法とほぼ同様であることから、『日本最古のログハウス』と称されることもある。
sen.e: Also, this construction method is very similar to the method used to a assemble a log cabin and therefore Shosoin is sometimes referred to as the oldest log cabin in Japan.
Also, this construction method is very similar to the one used to a assemble a log cabin, and therefore Shosoin is sometimes referred to as the oldest log cabin in Japan.
Also, this construction method is very similar to the one used to a assemble a log cabin, and therefore Shosoin is sometimes referred to as the oldest log cabin in Japan.

sen.j: 現存する奈良時代の倉庫としてはもっとも規模が大きい。
sen.e: Shosoin is the largest of the existing warehouses dating from the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Shosoin is the largest of the existing warehouses dating from the Nara period.
Shosoin is the largest of the existing warehouses dating from the Nara period.

sen.j: また、奈良時代の「正倉」の実態を伝える唯一の遺構として、建築史的にもきわめて価値の高いものである。
sen.e: Also it is the only relic which gives a true picture of "shoso" in the Nara period and so is an extremely important part of architectural history.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Also, it's the only relic that gives a true picture of "shoso" in the Nara period, so it's an extremely important part of architectural history.
Also, it is the only relic that gives a true picture of "shoso" in the Nara period, so it is an extremely important part of architectural history.

sen.j: 校倉造の宝庫は長年、宝物を守ってきた。
sen.e: The treasure house, which is in Azekura-zukuri style, has protected the treasures for a long time.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The treasure house, which is in the Azekura-zukuri style, has protected the treasures for a long time.
The treasure house, which is in the Azekura-zukuri style, has protected the treasures for a long time.

sen.j: 1952年に鉄筋コンクリート造の東宝庫、1962年には同じく鉄筋コンクリート造の西宝庫が完成し、翌1963年、宝物類はそちらへ移された。
sen.e: Both made of reinforced concrete, the East Treasure House was built in 1952, and the West Treasure House in 1962, with the treasures being moved there the following year (1963).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The East Treasure House was built in 1952 and the West Treasure House in 1962, both of concrete, and the treasures were moved there in 1963.
The East Treasure House was built in 1952 and the West Treasure House in 1962, both of concrete, and the treasures were moved there in 1963.

sen.j: 現在、宝物の大部分は西宝庫に収納、東宝庫には修理中の品や、西宝庫に収納スペースのない、大量の染織品が収納されている。
sen.e: Now most of the treasures are kept in the West Treasure House, while the East Treasure House holds articles currently under repair and many textiles which the West Treasure House doesn't have space for.

Today, most of the treasures are kept in the West Treasure House, while the East Treasure House holds articles undergoing repair and many textiles for which the West Treasure House doesn't have sufficient space.

Today, most of the treasures are kept in the West Treasure House, while the East Treasure House holds articles undergoing repair and many textiles for which the West Treasure House does not have sufficient space.

sen.j: 勅封はこの宝庫に施されている。
sen.e: These treasure houses are "chokufu (having an Imperial seal).
These treasure houses are "chokufu" (having the Imperial seal).
These treasure houses are "chokufu" (having the Imperial seal).

tit.e: Process of being designated as a national treasure
The process of designation as a national treasure
The process of designation as a national treasure

sen.j: 皇室用財産は国有財産であり、宮内庁の各部局（宮内庁長官官房、宮内庁侍従職、宮内庁書陵部、三の丸尚蔵館、宮内庁京都事務所、正倉院事務所が管理する。
sen.e: Grand Steward's Secretariat, Imperial Household Agency, the Board of Chamberlains of the Imperial Household Agency, Imperial Household Archives, The Museum of the Imperial Collections ("Sannnomaru Shozokan" in Japanese), Imperial Household Agency Kyoto Office and Shosoin Office administer the Imperial properties, which the nation owns.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Grand Steward's Secretariat, Imperial Household Agency, the Board of Chamberlains of the Imperial Household Agency, Imperial Household Archives, The Museum of the Imperial Collections ("Sannnomaru Shozokan" in Japanese), the Imperial Household Agency Kyoto Office and the Shosoin Office administer the imperial properties, which the nation owns.

The Grand Steward's Secretariat, Imperial Household Agency, the Board of Chamberlains of the Imperial Household Agency, Imperial Household Archives, The Museum of the Imperial Collections ("Sannnomaru Shozokan" in Japanese), the Imperial Household Agency Kyoto Office and the Shosoin Office administer the imperial properties, which the nation owns.

sen.j: これら一連の文化財は「宮内庁による十分な「管理」が行われている」との宮内庁見解にもとづき、文化財保護法による指定の対象外となっている。
sen.e: These properties are not included in the objects to be protected by the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties as Imperial Household Agency believes they fully administer the properties.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: These properties are not included among the objects to be protected by the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, since the Imperial Household Agency asserts that it fully administers the properties.

These properties are not included among the objects to be protected by the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, since the Imperial Household Agency asserts that it fully administers the properties.

sen.j: そのため、正倉院の建物や宝物も国宝・重要文化財等には一切指定されていなかった。
sen.e: For this reason, neither the Shosoin building nor its treasures were designated as either national treasures or important cultural properties.
Consequently, neither the Shosoin building nor its treasures have been designated as national treasures or important cultural properties.
Consequently, neither the Shosoin building nor its treasures have been designated as national treasures or important cultural properties.

sen.j: 「古都奈良の文化財」が国際連合教育科学文化機関の世界遺産として登録されることになった。
sen.e: It was decided to list the Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara as a UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) World Heritage site.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: It was decided to list the Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara as a UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) World Heritage site.
It was decided to list the Historic Monuments of Ancient Nara as a UNESCO (United Nations Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization) World Heritage site.

sen.j: 登録されるにあたり、当該文化財が所在国の法律によって保護の対象となっていることが条件であることから、正倉院の建物も、正倉院正倉として1997年5月19日、文化財保護法による国宝に指定された。
sen.e: One of the conditions for the cultural sites to be listed is that they must be protected by law of the country where they are located, so on May 19, 1997 the Shosoin building was designated as a national treasure regulated by the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, under the name of "Shosoin Shoso".
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: One of the conditions for the listing of cultural sites is that they must be protected by the law of the country in which they're located, so on May 19, 1997 the Shosoin building was designated as a national treasure regulated by the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, under the name of "Shosoin Shoso."

One of the conditions for the listing of cultural sites is that they must be protected by the law of the country in which they are located, so on May 19, 1997 the Shosoin building was designated as a national treasure regulated by the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties, under the name of "Shosoin Shoso."

sen.j: 国宝に指定されたのは宝庫の建物だけで、宝物類は指定されていない。
sen.e: Only the treasure house building was designated as a national treasure, whereas the treasures kept inside were not.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Only the treasure house building was designated as a national treasure, whereas the treasures kept inside were not.
Only the treasure house building was designated as a national treasure, whereas the treasures kept inside were not.

sen.j: 正倉院の構内にはもう1棟、小型の校倉造倉庫が建ち、「聖語蔵（しょうごぞう）」と呼ばれている。
sen.e: Shogozo, another small warehouse in Azekura-zukuri style, stands on the premises of Shosoin.
Shogozo, another small warehouse in the Azekura-zukuri style, stands on the premises of Shosoin.
Shogozo, another small warehouse in the Azekura-zukuri style, stands on the premises of Shosoin.

sen.j: これは東大寺尊勝院の経蔵を移築したもので、鎌倉時代の建物である。
sen.e: It is a sutra repository, built in the Kamakura period, then moved from Sonshoin, Todai-ji.
It's a sutra repository that was built in the Kamakura period and subsequently moved from Sonshoin, Todai-ji.
It is a sutra repository that was built in the Kamakura period and subsequently moved from Sonshoin, Todai-ji Temple.
sen.cmt: Todai-ji Templeとし、It's→It isとしました。

sen.j: ここに収蔵されていた経巻類約5,000点は明治27年（1894年）に皇室に献納された。
sen.e: About 5,000 of the scriptures kept here were dedicated to the Imperial Family in 1894.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Approximately 5,000 of the scriptures kept there were dedicated to the Imperial Family in 1894.
Approximately 5,000 of the scriptures kept there were dedicated to the Imperial Family in 1894.

sen.j: 現在は他の宝物と同様に宮内庁正倉院事務所が管理している。
sen.e: Together with the other treasures, these scriptures are administered by Shosoin Office, Imperial Household Agency.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Together with the other treasures, the scriptures are administered by the Shosoin Office, Imperial Household Agency.
Together with the other treasures, the scriptures are administered by the Shosoin Office, Imperial Household Agency.

tit.j: 正倉院の代表的な宝物

sen.j: 絵画
sen.e: Paintings
Paintings

sen.j: 鳥毛立女屏風（とりげりつじょのびょうぶ）：唐風の女性が描かれた六扇の屏風。
sen.e: Torige Ritsujo no Byobu: a six-panel folding screen of painted women dressed in Tang style

sen.j: 調度（漆工・木工）

sen.j: 東大寺献物帳：光明皇后が聖武天皇の遺品などを東大寺大仏へ献納した際の目録。
sen.e: Todai-ji Kenmotsu Cho: Catalogs made when Empress Komyo dedicated articles associated with the late Emperor Shomu amongst others to Great Buddha in Todai-ji Temple.

sen.j: 5種類あるが、中でも「国家珍宝帳」が著名。
sen.e: Especially Kokka Chinpo Cho (List of Nation's Rare Treasures) is the most famous of the five kinds of Kenmotsu Cho.
